column5: Sample Question
column6: Example Prospect Answer

column5: “What made you book this call?”
column6: “I’m still checking out different options. Just seeing what’s out there.”

column5: “Have you seen some of my work or testimonials?”
column6: “Yeah, I skimmed a few. Looks interesting.”

column5: “Why did you choose to speak with me specifically?”
column6: “I’ve followed your content for months. I trust how you approach this.”

column5: “What do you know about our firm?”
column6: “Not much yet. We’re just talking to a few vendors.”

column5: “What drew you to book this call?”
column6: “We saw a webinar — looked solid. Still evaluating.”

column5: “What made you consider us over others?”
column6: “You’ve worked with a company just like ours. Your results speak for themselves.”

column5: “How did you hear about me?”
column6: “Online. I’ve got a few agents I’m talking to.”

column5: “Why are you considering working with me?”
column6: “You were referred, and I’ve seen a couple of listings.”

column5: “Why me and why now?”
column6: “You’ve sold 3 homes in this area. I’ve been watching your results.”

column5: “Does this approach resonate with you?”
column6: “Not sure yet. I’ve tried a lot that didn’t work.”

column5: “How does this program feel so far?”
column6: “Parts of it make sense, I just don’t know if it’s the right time.”

column5: “Does this feel like the right fit for you?”
column6: “This feels exactly like what I’ve been looking for.”

column5: “Does this solution fit your goals?”
column6: “Hard to tell. We’re still reviewing others.”

column5: “Where does this rank compared to others you’ve seen?”
column6: “Top 3. Still some questions about implementation.”

column5: “What makes this a strong contender?”
column6: “You hit the nail on the head — this is the most aligned offer we’ve seen.”

column5: “How do you feel about the pricing strategy?”
column6: “Not sure. Another agent suggested something different.”

column5: “Do you feel confident in our plan to sell?”
column6: “Generally yes, but I’d want to see a bit more proof.”

column5: “How does this listing plan feel to you?”
column6: “It’s exactly what we were hoping for.”

column5: “What’s your biggest concern?”
column6: “Honestly, I’m not sure I’ll follow through.”

column5: “Do you think you can apply this work?”
column6: “I hope so. It depends on the support.”

column5: “What makes you ready now?”
column6: “I know if I commit to this, I’ll make it happen.”

column5: “Any risk to implementing this on your side?”
column6: “Yes — we’ve had initiatives fail before. I’m concerned.”

column5: “Do you feel ready to adopt a new system?”
column6: “Mostly. There are some team capability concerns.”

column5: “Can your team execute on this?”
column6: “Absolutely. We’re prepared and resourced.”

column5: “Are you ready to handle what this sale requires?”
column6: “I’m nervous. It’s a lot.”

column5: “Do you feel prepared for the next steps?”
column6: “Mostly. I just don’t want to mess it up.”

column5: “Do you feel confident about the sale process?”
column6: “Yes. Let’s do this.”

column5: “How do you feel about stepping into this?”
column6: “It’s scary. I’m afraid of failing again.”

column5: “Are you comfortable with the unknowns?”
column6: “Sort of. I’m trying to be.”

column5: “Are you open to taking a leap for growth?”
column6: “Yes — I know it’s time. I’m done hesitating.”

column5: “Is this decision risky for your team?”
column6: “Yes. We’d prefer to delay until everything’s certain.”

column5: “Is your team okay with some uncertainty here?”
column6: “Depends. We’d need strong reassurance.”

column5: “How does your team view the risk-reward tradeoff?”
column6: “They’re ready to move — no growth without risk.”

column5: “Are you worried about market timing?”
column6: “Yes. We may hold off.”

column5: “Do you feel comfortable listing now?”
column6: “I think so, but I’m nervous.”

column5: “Are you willing to list even with current uncertainty?”
column6: “Yes — let’s go. I believe it’s the right move.”
